articles.title: Coronavirus: Human organs could age 3-4 years faster after COVID infection, study shows - KGO-TV
articles.description: Study conducted from millions of Americans showed that several of their organs aged faster by three to four years, with the majority happening among those who were hospitalized, but also to some who had mild COVID symptoms.
articles.content:
SAN FRANCISCO (KGO) -- After over two and a half years of COVID research, scientists are seeing the first data points that prove a dramatic change in human organs after a COVID infection.

articles.title: Shingles Facts and Statistics: What You Need to Know - Verywell Health
articles.description: About 1 in 3 Americans will develop shingles at some point during their lifetime. Here’s what you should know about this painful condition.
